intro: Diarina, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and unique plant found in specific regions of Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers that appear during the winter months. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough, textured surface.
